Sentencas: In this work, the effect of microwave sintering on the properties of 1 mol% ceria-doped scandia stabilized zirconia (10Sc1CeSZ) was investigated.
Titulo: Microwave sintering of ceria-doped scandia stabilized zirconia as electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The sintering was carried out at temperatures 1300 degrees C and 1350 degrees C for 15 min using a 2.45 GHz microwave furnace.
Titulo: Microwave sintering of ceria-doped scandia stabilized zirconia as electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The sintering behavior of the microwave sintered ceramics was compared with that obtained via the conventional sintering at temperatures ranging from 1300 degrees C to 1550 degrees C with 2 h holding time.
Titulo: Microwave sintering of ceria-doped scandia stabilized zirconia as electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: It was found that both sintering processes yielded highly dense samples with minimum density of 98% theoretical value.
Titulo: Microwave sintering of ceria-doped scandia stabilized zirconia as electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Phase analysis by X-ray diffraction revealed the presences of only cubic phase in all sintered samples.
Titulo: Microwave sintering of ceria-doped scandia stabilized zirconia as electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: All sintered pellets possessed high Vickers hardness (13-14.6 GPa) and fracture toughness (similar to 3 MPa m(1/2)).
Titulo: Microwave sintering of ceria-doped scandia stabilized zirconia as electrolyte for solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Microstructural examination by using the scanning electron microscope showed that the grain size varied from 2.9 to 9.8 gm for the conventional sintered samples whereas the grain size of the microwave sintered ceramics was below 2 mu m. Electrochemical Impedance Spectroscopy study recorded the maximum ionic conductivity of 0.280 S/cm at 800 degrees C for the conventional-sintered sample at 1550 degrees C whereas a high value of 0.314 S/cm was measured for the microwave-sintered sample at 1350 degrees C.
